text:
I am trying to initialize a variable as `arr =  Vector{Tuple{Float64, Vector{Float64}}}()` because I will grow it with `push!`
However, I would like to have more than that, the first type is fixed as `Float64` but I want to have more than one `Vector{Float64}` , e.g. `arr =  Vector{Tuple{Float64, Vector{Float64}, Vector{Float64}}}()` .
Is there a way to initialized my variable with N tuple elements of the same type? I don't expect more than 5.

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/55613| to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!
`Tuple{Int, Tuple{(Vector{Int} for _ in 1:3)...}}` or maybe better `Tuple{Int, Tuple{ntuple(_ -> Vector{Int}, 3)...}}`
of course! I can use a comprehension! :man-facepalming:

elements.text: of course! I can use a comprehension!

text: Sometimes my python interferes with my Julia :stuck_out_tongue:
